Hi Brooke and Jen,

Great news — the Zapier Zaps are all working smoothly now.
We’ve updated everything across the board, not just the Sydney setup.

Thanks again for your patience while we sorted this out!

Hi Joel,

Please go ahead and remove Mailchimp on all/any - its no longer in use

Regards,

Ben Rookes

Operations MANAGER



0456 553 848



03 9580 4102



brookes@novaricollective.com



Unit 74-76 Industrial Drive, Braeside VIC 3195



NOVARICOLLECTIVE.COM.AU







The content of this email is confidential and intended for the recipient specified only. It is strictly forbidden to share any part of this message with any third party without the sender's written consent. If you received this by mistake, please reply and delete it to avoid recurrence.

Hi Ben,

Thanks so much for sending through the logins.

You’re correct—it is the same active Zap. The issue is with the Mailchimp step: the account connection has expired.

To fix it, we just need your help to:
  • Reconnect the Mailchimp account in Zapier (click the “Reconnect this account” button), if Mailchimp is still in use.
  • Or, if Mailchimp is no longer required in this workflow, we can disable/remove that step to prevent the errors.

Once that’s done, the rest of the Zap (Gravity Forms → Xero draft invoice) should continue to run smoothly.

Doesn't look like V3 is there. Login details are accounts@novaricollective.com Novari2025!!@@ if you want to login and have a look Joel



Regards,

Ben Rookes

Hi Ben,

Thanks so much for sending the screenshot over.

I had a look at the syd-proposal Gravity Form, and it’s currently using “Proposal Acceptance → Xero Draft Invoice → V3”, which is showing as the active feed. That means V3 is the one running now, while the screenshot you shared was from the older V2 setup.

Could you please check the “Proposal Acceptance → Xero Draft Invoice → V3” Zap on your side? Here’s a quick way to verify that it’s working as expected:
  1. Make sure the V3 Zap is ON in Zapier.
  2. Submit a quick test via the Proposal Acceptance form.
  3. In Zapier Task History, confirm the run succeeded.
  4. In Xero, check that a draft invoice was created.

Let us know how you go with the test—we’re happy to jump in and assist if needed.

support@wolfiq.com.au I have access to that email address. See below, what needs to be done?



Regards,

Ben Rookes

Hi Jen,

Really appreciate you jumping on this so quickly.

From what I can trace, the account was originally set up under accounts@novaricollective.com. It might be worth trying a password reset to see if that clears things up. Also do you think Ben Rookes might also have an idea on this?

We’ll help get this sorted straight away, thanks again.

Hi Joel,

We don't have access to that email, any chance you could please change to admin@novaricollective.com?

No invoices are being generated so this has become quite an issue - would like to get it resolved asap so let me know if there's anything else you need from me.

Warm regards,

Jen Lovegrove

Hi Jen,

Thanks so much for your response.

Zapier is a plugin we use to link proposal system with Xero, which allows invoices to be created automatically without any manual work. After checking back through the setup, we found that the user account connected to Zapier is accounts@novaricollective.com.

Let me know if you have access to this.

Hi Joel,

Thanks for looking into this. What is Zapier?

Warm regards,

Jen Lovegrove

Hi Jen,
I hope you’re doing well.

Thanks for letting us know about this. It looks like we may have lost access to Zapier, which is likely why the invoice hasn’t been created in Xero. If you could please help us with access, we’ll be able to dig in further and get this sorted for you.

Really appreciate your patience, and we’ll keep you updated as we work through it.

Hi Jen,

Happy Monday!

Thank you so much for letting us know. We’ve looked into this and our developers are investigating further.

Since this may require deeper checks on the backend, we’ll have our senior developer review it and provide an update as soon as possible.

We really appreciate your patience, and we’ll keep you posted.
